MAN.TITLE: xget
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: get current values of the graphics context

PARAM_DESCRIPTION.SP: : optional. Set to 1 gives a verbose mode.

DESCRIPTION.P: This function is used to get values from the graphics context on the topic specified by the string str. When called with no argument, a choice menu is created showing the current values and changes can be performed through toggle buttons.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: number=xget("alufunction")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the logical function number used for drawing. See xset.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: str=xget("auto clear")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the auto clear status ("on" or "off").

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: color=xget("background")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the background color of the current graphics window.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: rect=xget("clipping")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the clipping zone as a rectangle rect=[x,y,w,h] (Upper-Left point Width Height).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: c=xget("color")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the default color for filling, line or text drawing functions. c is an integer projected in the interval [0,whiteid]. 0 stands for black filling and whiteid for white. The value of whiteid can be obtained with xget("white").

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: cmap=xget("colormap")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the colormap used for the current graphics window as a m x 3 RGB matrix.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: dash=xget("dashes")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the dash style dash=[dash_number] where dash_number is the id of the dash. This keyword is obsolete, please use xget("color") or xget("line style") instead.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: font=xget("font")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get font=[fontid,fontsize], the default font and the default size for fonts. size.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: fontsize=xget("font size")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the default size for fonts size.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: color=xget("foreground")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the foreground color of the current graphics window.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: str=xget("fpf")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the floating point format for number display in contour functions. Note that str is "" when default format is used.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: color=xget("hidden3d")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the color number for hidden faces in plot3d.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: pat=xget("lastpattern")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the id of the last available pattern or color, with the current colormap of the current window. In fact pat+1 and pat+2 are also available and stand respectively for black and white pattern.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: type=xget("line mode")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the line drawing mode. type=1 is absolute mode and type=0 is relative mode. (Warning: the mode type=0 is has bugs)

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: xget("line style")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the default line style (1: solid, >1 for dashed lines).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: mark=xget("mark")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the default mark id and the default marks size. mark=[markid,marksize].

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: marksize=xget("mark size")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the default marks size.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: pat=xget("pattern")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the current pattern or the current color. pat is an integer in the range [1,last]. When one uses black and white, 0 is used for black filling and last for white. The value of last can be obtained with xget("lastpattern").

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: value=xget("thickness")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the thickness of lines in pixel (0 and 1 have the same meaning: 1 pixel thick).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: flag=xget("use color")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the flag 0 (use black and white) or 1 (use colors). See xset.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: [x,y]=xget("viewport")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the current postion of the visible part of graphics in the panner.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: dim=xget("wdim")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the width and the height of the current graphics window dim=[width,height].

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: win=xget("window")
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the current window number win.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: pos=xget("wpos");
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Get the position of the upper left point of the graphics window pos=[x,y].
